CdrDoc.CdrDocXml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <xsl:transform xmlns:xsl = "http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version = "1.0" xmlns:cdr = "cips.nci.nih.gov/cdr">
<xsl:output method = "xml" />
<xsl:template match = "/"> <xsl:apply-templates select = "Person"/> </xsl:template>
<!-- ====================================================================== Drop this and its children. 2005-05-05: logic more complicated now; users want to keep information about membership in Voluntary Protocol Review Boards. ====================================================================== --> <xsl:template match = "PDQBoardMembershipDetails"> <xsl:if test = 'PDQVoluntaryProtocolReviewBoard'> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select = "@*|node()|comment()| processing-instruction()"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:if> </xsl:template>
<!-- ====================================================================== If the ProfessionalInformation element would be empty after stripping out board information, drop it. ====================================================================== --> <xsl:template match = "ProfessionalInformation"> <xsl:if test = "PhysicianDetails | GeneticsProfessionalDetails | PDQBoardMembershipDetails/ PDQVoluntaryProtocolReviewBoard"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select = "@*|node()|comment()| processing-instruction()"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:if> </xsl:template>
<!-- Drop these. --> <xsl:template match = "PDQEditorialBoard|PDQAdvisoryBoard"/>
<!-- Keep everything else. --> <xsl:template match = "@*|node()|comment()| processing-instruction()"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select = "@*|node()|comment()| processing-instruction()"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:template>
</xsl:transform>
